column4: Students take a stand along a "Strongly Agree <--> Strongly Disagree" line on statements about conflict/discipline, brifely explain their positions, then doa quick debrief.This activity aims to develop self-awareness self-management, decision-making skills, and responsible behaviors in personal, school, and community contexts.

column4: Students stand in a big circle; on “Mingle!” they greet, then form groups by the called number to answer a quick prompt—repeat 2–3 rounds to warm up, check in, and build community. This activity aims to build active listening, perspective-taking, communication, and reflection.

Using community inspired murals to celebrate unity through art, recognising the transformative power of creativity, understanding, and community engagement.

Murals on walls that include people from all student identity groups
- Could change each year
- Students could vote on designs
- Incorporating positive messaging
- Students could do the muraling/designing

column3: Mapping Identity in Content through Concept Maps

Pose questions to students about what parts of their identities they see represented in the concept maps that have been created.

column4: Activity plans tailored to different age levels
Work to make all students feel safe and welcome. Greet students by name when they enter school/classrooms, have sufficient adult presence in hallways, cafeteria, gym, etc

Using input from students, families, and staff, develop a small set of routines that 1) let students and staff know what to expect in each class., and in each day and 2) Promote connection, well-being, and joy.
Adolescents are developing their sense of self and how they fit with others. Provide opportunities for students to do so.

Onboarding students in a new context provides a means for students to successfully assimilate into the culture of your school by assisting them through a series of activities designed to create an understanding of and a familiarity with the context of the school to ensure students can successfully continue their learning journey and attain their personal goals and aspirations
